intro: Coussapoa parviceps, commonly known as the small-headed cupuaçu, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant produces a fruit similar to the cupuaçu, which is used in traditional medicine and as a source of edible oil. Its botanical features include a woody stem, hairy foliage, and a unique floral structure that facilitates pollination by insects. Coussapoa parviceps is adapted to the humid, shaded environments of the understory in its native habitat.
